description: Struggling with mounting abuses and internal sweeps for nonconformity, Oksana Lintz resolves to act. She quietly leaks Halden's 'spiral effect' code—enabling decentralized, transparent scoring—to trusted community contacts.

With guidance from Oksana and Lenart, neighborhood circles and activists begin decoding the spiral code, using symbols from Halden's diaries to unlock BCI controls. Small, protected assemblies test the new system in secret.

Word spreads of the 'spiral effect.' Neighborhoods seize control of local BCI scoring. Scores rotate publicly and unpredictably, eroding centralized Council power. Citizens hold open forums, debating their own allocations.
BCI scoring loses all enforcement value. Local assemblies formally replace Council appointments with rotating facilitators. Open debate and shared management become standard across most districts.
After a week of self-organization and mutual aid, Council officials appear at public forums for the first time, forced to answer to citizens as community self-governance becomes the city’s default.
